Ingredients.4: 1 (6 ounce) package quick-cooking stuffing mix (such as Stove Top®), or more to taste

Ingredients.7: 3 stalks celery, diced, or more to taste

Ingredients.8: 1 (10.5 ounce) can  low-sodium cream of chicken soup

Ingredients.9: 0.5 (10.5 ounce) can  low-sodium cream of mushroom soup

Ingredients.11: 1 whole cooked rotisserie chicken - skinned, boned, and meat shredded

Ingredients.12: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Bring water and 1/4 cup butter to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add stuffing mix and stir to combine. Remove the saucepan from the heat, cover, and let sit until water is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Fluff stuffing with a fork.

Directions.3: While you are preparing the stuffing, melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery; cook and stir until softened, 5 to 10 minutes.

Directions.4: Mix both condensed soups with sour cream in a bowl until well combined.

Directions.5: Spread shredded chicken in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Layer onion mixture over the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Top with soup mixture and spread stuffing evenly over top.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is bubbly and topping is golden brown, about 1 hour.
